questions.question:
Let P be a regular language and Q be a context free language such that Q \(\subseteq\) P. (For example, let P be the language represented by the regular expression p*q* and Q be \(\{p^{n}q^{n}|n\in N\}\) Then which of the following is ALWAYS regular?

(GATE CSE 2011)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Which of the following pairs have DIFFERENT expressive power?

(GATE CSE 2011)
options:
A.

Deterministic finite automata (DFA) and Non-deterministic finite automata (NFA)

B.

Deterministic push down automata (DPDA) and Non-deterministic push down automata (NPDA)

C.

Deterministic single-tape Turing machine and Non-deterministic single tape Turing machine

D.

Single-tape Turing machine and multi-tape Turing machine
questions.correct_answer:
B.

Deterministic push down automata (DPDA) and Non-deterministic push down automata (NPDA)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Let w be any string of length n in {0, 1}*. Let L be the set of all substrings of w. What is the minimum number of states in a non-deterministic finite automaton that accepts L?

(GATE CSE 2010)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Consider the languages
\(L1=\{0^{i}1^{j}\;| \; i\neq j\}\).
\(L2=\{0^{i}1^{j}\;| \; i=j\}\).
\(L3=\{0^{i}1^{j}\;| \; i=2j+1\}\).
\(L4=\{0^{i}1^{j}\;| \; i \neq 2j\}\)
Which one of the following statements is true?

(GATE CSE 2010)
options:
B.

Only L2 and L3 are context free

C.

Only L1 and L3 are context free
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:

questions.question:
Given the following state table of an FSM with two states A and B, one input and one output:

If the initial state is A = 0, B=0, what is the minimum length of an input string which will take the machine to the state A=0, B=1 with Output=1?

(GATE CSE 2009)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Which one of the following is FALSE?

(GATE CSE 2009)
options:
A.

There is unique minimal DFA for every regular language

B.

Every NFA can be converted to an equivalent PDA.

C.

Complement of every context-free language is recursive.

D.

Every nondeterministic PDA can be converted to an equivalent deterministic PDA.
questions.correct_answer:
D.

Every nondeterministic PDA can be converted to an equivalent deterministic PDA.
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Which one of the following languages over the alphabet {0,1} is described by the regular expression: (0+1)*0(0+1)*0(0+1)*?

(GATE CSE 2009)
options:
A.

The set of all strings containing the substring 00.

B.

The set of all strings containing at most two 0's.

C.

The set of all strings containing at least two 0's.

D.

The set of all strings that begin and end with either 0 or 1
questions.correct_answer:
C.

The set of all strings containing at least two 0's.
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
A CFG G is given with the following productions where S is the start symbol, A is a non-terminal and a and b are terminals.

\(\begin{array}{l} S \rightarrow a S \mid A \\ A \rightarrow a A b|b A a| \epsilon \end{array}\)

For the string "aabbaab" how many steps are required to derive the string and how many parse trees are there?

(GATE IT 2008)
